intro: Pocockia ruthenica var. liaosiensis, commonly known as the Liaosiensis Pocockia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a delicate, white or pale yellow color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
